title: Freeware DOS C or Pascal compilers? (16-bit real mode)
content:
I'm looking for free C (not necessarily C++) or Pascal compilers for real mode DOS. DJGPP, unfortunately, only produces protected mode DOS applications.

What's all this for? For experimenting with CKPatch's source code, and also to write an utility called "modstub" that could be used for Keen2/3/5/6 mods (not written yet, although I have the general idea written down somehwere).------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Freeware DOS C or Pascal compilers? (16-bit real mode)
content:
That's a difficult one. I think there's a Borland C compiler that worked in 16-bit mode, and was released freely to the public at some point. Good luck searching the Borland site though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Freeware DOS C or Pascal compilers? (16-bit real mode)
content:
Yeah Borland released their compiler a while back, but I can't remember whether it did real mode or not. I think it was actually pretty easy to find though.

Back in the days of DOS there weren't many free compilers, so I think you'll have a tricky time finding a free one from that era.

title: Re: Freeware DOS C or Pascal compilers? (16-bit real mode)
content:
